etymologies: mid 19th century: modern Latin, from Ytterby, the name of a village in Sweden where it was discovered. Compare with erbium and ytterbium

definitions: the chemical element of atomic number 65, a silvery-white metal of the lanthanide series. The main use of terbium is in making semiconductors.
shortDefinitions: chemical element of atomic number 65, silvery-white metal of lanthanide series
